DataElement.preferredName: First Degree Relative Cancer Diagnosis Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate if there is an immediate family member (i.e., biological parents, siblings, children) with a history of cancer other than basal/squamous cell skin cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Report or record of a cancer diagnosis in any relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

Concepts.definition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Data Not Available Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, not applicable, or that the data is not present in the original source.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes, No, or Unknown Response Source Data Not Available Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.:Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/24/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review due to reuse. 1/3/21 jk Added PV "Not reported" for Clinical Core dataset. 10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.  9/12/19 jk revised definition to reflect the null values for MCL Breast core content.   3/12/17 jk created as a Standard MCL VD.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any of your living and deceased first degree blood relatives been diagnosed with cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL Core
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any of your living and deceased first degree blood relatives (biological parents, siblings, children) been diagnosed with cancer [other than basal/squamous cell skin cancer]? [Not including half-siblings, step-siblings, step-parents, or step-children].

ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any of your living and deceased first degree blood relatives (biological parents, siblings, children) been diagnosed with cancer [other than basal/squamous cell skin cancer]?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any of your living and deceased first degree blood relatives (biological parents, siblings, children) been diagnosed with cancer [other than basal/squamous cell skin cancer]?

ReferenceDocuments.name: MCL-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: First degree relatives only: not including half-siblings, step-siblings, step-parents, or step-children.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/25/21 jk Released, upd Reg Status per SME (KA) review and approval. 1/4/21 jk versioned to upd DEC to link to CDE 3171640 and revised PV list.  1/21/20 jk removed from MCL Biospecimen CSI. 1/29/19 jk released, classified for MCL Core finalization and PCA CSI.  8/5/18 jk upd short name/long/def to reflect concept pref terms.  7/17/18 jk revised MCL Core CSI mapping. 6/20/16 moved to MCL context, added to Core CSI. jk 5/12/16 created for MCL Core data set. jk
